title: Can't change client to Korean anymore (even on legacy client)?
body: I've changed my client language to Korean many times in the past, but now after changing the locale (for legacy client), an error message pops up that states, "명시되지 않은 오류가 발생했습니다. 자세한 정보는 로그를 확인하십시오," or "An unspecified error has occurred. Please check the log for more information." Has anyone come across this error and got past it or is it now impossible to put your client in Korean? I know it doesn't really work with the newer client, but it appears that there's problems even when trying to change the legacy client's locale/language.

replies.body: Our NA server doesn't officially support the Korean language, so you won't be able to change the language to Korean. You can find a list of each region's supported languages in [**this article**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201751594-Changing-Game-Language).

> [{quoted}](name=Broporo,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=w3E4M3h3,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2017-04-16T22:38:42.526+0000)
>
> Our NA server doesn't officially support the Korean language, so you won't be able to change the language to Korean. You can find a list of each region's supported languages in [**this article**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201751594-Changing-Game-Language).

It's interesting you say something that's blatantly false. I'm obviously from OCE and our only "supported" language is English and yet I can change to every language except for Korean and the Garena languages. It seems the "supported languages" have more to do with what servers Riot has control over.

> [{quoted}](name=Akuen,realm=OCE,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=w3E4M3h3,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2017-05-03T00:35:29.886+0000)
>
> It's interesting you say something that's blatantly false. I'm obviously from OCE and our only "supported" language is English and yet I can change to every language except for Korean and the Garena languages. It seems the "supported languages" have more to do with what servers Riot has control over.

He's right. There's no reason to not allow the client to be in Korean. I have a friend that moved from Korea and she wants to learn the game but it's extremely difficult when she can't even set it to her native language. She hardly knows what anything says. {{summoner:14}}
